p: Crataeva nurvala Buch.-Ham (Capparidaceae) is a well-recognized medicinal plant of the Indian traditional system of medicine used for various therapeutic purposes since ancient times (Goyal et al. 2010). C. nurvala has been evaluated for the management of urolithiasis (Agarwal et al. 2010), obstructive uropathies, neurogenic bladder, chronic urinary infections (Cho et al. 2015) and kidney stone (Yadav et al. 2016). In vivo studies have proved that C. nurvala stem bark has a protective role against free radical-induced toxicity in experimental urolithiasis and hepatotoxicity (Sunitha et al. 2001).
